    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void attach()
      This method is called when Qorus starts working on a workflow order data instance; it in turn calls attachImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses If any error is raised in the attach method (by calling OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::stepError() "WorkflowApi::stepError()" in %Qore code or com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.stepError() "WorkflowApi.stepError()" in Java code) or by throwing an appropriate exception), the workflow order data instance will receive an OMQ::StatError status and the attach operation will fail.
      protected void attachImpl()
      This method is called when Qorus starts working on a workflow order data instance; this method may be overridden in subclasses If any error is raised in the attach method (by calling OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::stepError() "WorkflowApi::stepError()" in %Qore code or com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.stepError() "WorkflowApi.stepError()" in Java code) or by throwing an appropriate exception), the workflow order data instance will receive an OMQ::StatError status and the attach operation will fail.
      void detach​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String external_order_instanceid)
      This method is called when the workflow order data instance status is committed to the database; it in turn calls detachImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses The first argument passed to the method is the workflow order data instance's status (StatusDescriptions "status descriptions") that will be written to the database.
      protected void detachImpl​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String external_order_instanceid)
      This method is called when the workflow order data instance status is committed to the database; this method may be overridden in subclasses The first argument passed to the method is the workflow order data instance's status (StatusDescriptions "status descriptions") that will be written to the database.
      void errorHandler​(java.lang.String errcode, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> errinfo, java.lang.Object opt)
      This method is called when errors are raised; it in turn calls errorHandlerImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses This method allows the workflow to do external logging or to take custom actions when errors are raised.
      protected void errorHandlerImpl​(java.lang.String errcode, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> errinfo, java.lang.Object opt)
      This method is called when errors are raised and may be overridden in subclasses This method allows the workflow to do external logging or to take custom actions when errors are raised.
      void oneTimeInit()
      This method is executed once when the workflow execution instance starts or is reset; it in turn calls oneTimeInitImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses
      protected void oneTimeInitImpl()
      This method is executed once when the workflow execution instance starts or is reset; this method may be overridden in subclasses

    • Constructor Detail

      • QorusWorkflow

        public QorusWorkflow()

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public final void attach()
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when Qorus starts working on a workflow order data instance; it in turn calls attachImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses If any error is raised in the attach method (by calling OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::stepError() "WorkflowApi::stepError()" in %Qore code or com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.stepError() "WorkflowApi.stepError()" in Java code) or by throwing an appropriate exception), the workflow order data instance will receive an OMQ::StatError status and the attach operation will fail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        tempdata "TempData" can only be reliably set in the attach method, because a workflow can be restarted from any step after an error. Therefore you cannot ensure that tempdata "TempData" set in other step code will be available when executing the following step, in case an error occurs.

      • detach

        public final void detach​(java.lang.String status,
                         java.lang.String external_order_instanceid)
                  throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when the workflow order data instance status is committed to the database; it in turn calls detachImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses The first argument passed to the method is the workflow order data instance's status (StatusDescriptions "status descriptions") that will be written to the database. The second argument passed is the external order instance ID, if any exists.
        Parameters:
        status - The status being set for the workflow order data instance, see StatusDescriptions
        external_order_instanceid - The external key for the workflow data being processed, if any exists, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • oneTimeInit

        public final void oneTimeInit()
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is executed once when the workflow execution instance starts or is reset; it in turn calls oneTimeInitImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        Persistent objects with a high acquisition cost should be acquired in the oneTimeInit() method. Use the OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::updateInstanceData() "WorkflowApi::updateInstanceData()" method (in %Qore) or the com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.updateInstanceData() "WorkflowApi.updateInstanceData()" method (in Java) to save resources acquired, and OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::getInstanceData() "WorkflowApi::getInstanceData()" (in %Qore) or the com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.getInstanceData() "WorkflowApi.getInstanceData()" method (in Java) to retrieve the resources during the workflow's execution.

      • errorHandler

        public final void errorHandler​(java.lang.String errcode,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> errinfo,
                               java.lang.Object opt)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when errors are raised; it in turn calls errorHandlerImpl() which can be overridden in subclasses This method allows the workflow to do external logging or to take custom actions when errors are raised. The default implementation in the base class is empty.
        Parameters:
        errcode - the error code string (ex: "QORE-EXCEPTION")
        errinfo - this parameter will only be present if the error has been defined by as a workflow error; if so, the hash should have at least the following keys (key names in square brackets (i.e. [name]) are optional):
        • desc: description of the error
        • severity: ErrorSeverityCodes
        • status: either OMQ::StatRetry (meaning that the step should be retried) or OMQ::StatError
        • [retry-delay]: the delay in seconds before the error should be retried (only valid when "status" is OMQ::StatRetry)
        • [business]: if "True", this error represents a business error (rather than a technical error); usually implying that there is a problem with the consistency of the order data
        opt - an optional parameter that can be supplied by the workflow when an error is raised, normally a string providing additional information about the error
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • attachImpl

        protected void attachImpl()
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when Qorus starts working on a workflow order data instance; this method may be overridden in subclasses If any error is raised in the attach method (by calling OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::stepError() "WorkflowApi::stepError()" in %Qore code or com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.stepError() "WorkflowApi.stepError()" in Java code) or by throwing an appropriate exception), the workflow order data instance will receive an OMQ::StatError status and the attach operation will fail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        tempdata "TempData" can only be reliably set in the attach method, because a workflow can be restarted from any step after an error. Therefore you cannot ensure that tempdata "TempData" set in other step code will be available when executing the following step, in case an error occurs.

      • detachImpl

        protected void detachImpl​(java.lang.String status,
                          java.lang.String external_order_instanceid)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when the workflow order data instance status is committed to the database; this method may be overridden in subclasses The first argument passed to the method is the workflow order data instance's status (StatusDescriptions "status descriptions") that will be written to the database. The second argument passed is the external order instance ID, if any exists.
        Parameters:
        status - The status being set for the workflow order data instance, see StatusDescriptions
        external_order_instanceid - The external key for the workflow data being processed, if any exists, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • oneTimeInitImpl

        protected void oneTimeInitImpl()
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is executed once when the workflow execution instance starts or is reset; this method may be overridden in subclasses
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
        Note:
        Persistent objects with a high acquisition cost should be acquired in the oneTimeInit() method. Use the OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::updateInstanceData() "WorkflowApi::updateInstanceData()" method (in %Qore) or the com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.updateInstanceData() "WorkflowApi.updateInstanceData()" method (in Java) to save resources acquired, and OMQ::UserApi::Workflow::WorkflowApi::getInstanceData() "WorkflowApi::getInstanceData()" (in %Qore) or the com.qoretechnologies.qorus.workflow.WorkflowApi.getInstanceData() "WorkflowApi.getInstanceData()" method (in Java) to retrieve the resources during the workflow's execution.

      • errorHandlerImpl

        protected void errorHandlerImpl​(java.lang.String errcode,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> errinfo,
                                java.lang.Object opt)
                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is called when errors are raised and may be overridden in subclasses This method allows the workflow to do external logging or to take custom actions when errors are raised. The default implementation in the base class is empty.
        Parameters:
        errcode - the error code string (ex: "QORE-EXCEPTION")
        errinfo - this parameter will only be present if the error has been defined as a workflow error; if so, the hash should have at least the following keys (key names in square brackets (i.e. [name]) are optional):
        • desc: description of the error
        • severity: ErrorSeverityCodes
        • status: either OMQ::StatRetry (meaning that the step should be retried) or OMQ::StatError
        • [retry-delay]: the delay in seconds before the error should be retried (only valid when "status" is OMQ::StatRetry)
        • [business]: if "True", this error represents a business error (rather than a technical error); usually implying that there is a problem with the consistency of the order data
        opt - an optional parameter that can be supplied by the workflow when an error is raised, normally a string providing additional information about the error
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
